text: Patrick McDonnell (Irish: Pádraig Mac Domhnaill, born 1967) is an Irish actor and comedian. He has starred in the RTÉ hidden camera comedy show Naked Camera and the sketch show Stew. However he is probably best remembered at home and abroad for his role as Eoin McLove in the Channel 4 sitcom Father Ted. Patrick McDonnell is a native of Dromiskin, County Louth. He studied in Dundalk CBS and St Patrick's College, Maynooth holding a master's degree in Irish history.http://entertainment.ie/comedy/feature/Patrick-McDonnell-In- Profile/209/1459.htm He has played various roles in hit Irish comedy show The Savage Eye, which is written and also co-stars David McSavage. ==Career== * Stephanie Knows Who (1994) (Short) * Father Ted (TV series) (1998) * Don't Feed the Gondolas (TV series) * Separation Anxiety (2002) * Stew (TV series) (Various Roles) (2004) * Naked Camera (TV series) (Producer) (2005–2007) * Comedy Showcase (TV series) (2007) * The Savage Eye (Various Roles) (2009–Present) * Val Falvey TD (TV series) (2009) * Small, Far Away: The World of Father Ted (TV documentary) (2011) * Moone Boy * The Young Offenders (1 episode) (Guard) (2020) ==References== Category:Living people Category:Alumni of St Patrick's College, Maynooth Category:Irish male television actors Category:Irish male comedians Category:Irish stand-up comedians Category:People from County Louth Category:1967 births
title: Patrick McDonnell (actor)
